emuInput.TitMainTitle: Reporters George E. Pitts and Mal Goode speaking with Nat King Cole in restaurant at Carlton House Hotel
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 5, 1956, pg. A35, reads: "Nat Cole Talks - Nat (King) Cole tells his side of the Birmingham (Ala.) incident in which he was attacked by hoodlums during a concert. Listening are George E. Pitts, Courier theatrical reporter, left, and Mal Goode, WHOD newscaster, in Carlton House, where the King rested prior to playing two sell-out concerts at Syria Mosque. - Harris Photo."
